topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d63516368727e7cee0200#post_538d63516368727e7cee0200
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d62186368727da25a0200#post_538d62186368727da25a0200

If it turns out to be true, then it would actually explain a lot. 

Mankind could be a flawed program and other species are using is to run tests to see what decisions they need to take based on the consequences of what we do. The A.I. Evolves, but never to a point where it reaches the system and is discreetely throw back to prevent an anormal growth.[/bq]
Or... the universes could be a simulation simply of different set of physics through which it carries out and we're a byproduct.  Basically if you can simulate a universe from top to bottom then it's going to cause virtual beings to come to place.  No real plan on how to make us, just go "boom physics" and wait.

I always had the suspicion we were Sims[/bq]
More like Spore really.

If a real universe didn't have time then you could pretty much have unlimited processing power on a computer because everything would be happening all at once.  If that's the case we could very well be on someone's laptop as a video game or something cause if a laptop has âˆžghz processor then simulating a universe with time would be no chore at all.

Basically in a universe without time since everything is happening all at once you could do something like that.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d66646368727d040c0400#post_538d66646368727d040c0400

Yeah, but you're talking about separating the concepts of space and time, which means that if time doesn't pass, there's nothing moving either. So the processor could not really exist because like you said, all is happening at once and there's nothing to prevent all those processes to pile up and overload because they have no place to go.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d66fe6368727a9b5e0400#post_538d66fe6368727a9b5e0400
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d66646368727d040c0400#post_538d66646368727d040c0400
I think I posted a study a page or three back showing that sentient AI is impossible.[/bq]
That's cause the current way they do Ai is more for crunching large numbers; not sapience.  We won't be able to have sentient Ai until the blue brain project finishes cause without that we're missing key information about how minds work.  It's like trying to program in C++ and not being able to include #include <iostream>;  It's like trying to get a fish to climb a tree and wondering why it can't.

*edit
Damn; ninja'd
